name: Rise Consulting, LLC
description: Offers racial equity-centered services, strategies, frameworks, tools, and training programs to address structural racism and create racial equity outcomes. They partner with leaders and organizations to eliminate racial inequities
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: Vermont Professionals of Color Network (VT PoC)
description: This network provides business coaching, training, networking, and career support for Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) business owners and workers in Vermont. They contract with the Vermont Agency of Commerce and Community Development for these services
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: Project 986 Consulting
description: Provides DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) support, services, and coaching on best practices for changing attitudes and establishing institutional policies. They focus on justice-centered diversity and inclusion services for marginalized communities, including people of color
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: Vermont Partnership for Fairness and Diversity
description: A division of CRJ Consulting Group, L3C, this organization works to make Vermont a model for inclusive and equitable business practices. They offer professional development and training on inclusion, bias, and equity
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: Vital Leadership Coaching
description: A Vermont-based firm providing strategic planning, leadership team, and executive development services. They focus on organizational transformation and equipping clients to embrace change and realize their full potential
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: TBW-Consulting
description: Offers coaching, change management, design thinking, leadership development, and talent management services. The founder, Tess Weinisch, has extensive experience in these areas and is passionate about helping individuals realize their authentic selves to bring positive change
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: Vermont Diversity Council (VTDC)
description: Provides consulting services to help organizations create trusting and inclusive environments. They offer a customizable consulting model for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI)
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: Upper Valley BIPOC Network
description: Dedicated to creating opportunities that uplift BIPOC individuals, including providing access to resources, mentorship, leadership positions, and professional development
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: Blackshires
description: Offers a Community Leadership Academy and Fellowship Program dedicated to cultivating BIPOC leaders for municipal boards and committees. They also have a Leadership Accelerator program for Black community members
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation

name: The Vermont Professionals of Color Network (VT PoC) - BIPOC Business Directory
description: This directory lists various BIPOC-owned businesses in Vermont, which may include those offering leadership development or related services. Examples from the directory include Unlikely Riders (nonprofit), Mama Pho (restaurant), Country Roads Catering Service, xQween (self-care products), Homebody Massage + Yoga, Max Razy (clothing), ByMezzy LLC (graphic design), Harmony Edosomwan (poet/activist), Akweley Design (jewelry), Lotus Moon Vermont (herbal manufacturing/counseling), Peace & Justice Center, Parkside Cafe, A Single Pebble, Witfit Fitness, Living Proof Mentoring, Nest Coffee & Bakery, El Gato Cantina, McKenzie Business Services, and Shinjuku Station
services: Black-owned Leadership development in Vermont consultation
